page.title: 10LEEDSTOWN HUNT
page.content: At the start of the hunt we all met at Leedstown Hall. We waited until the Masters in the red jackets thought everyone was there and it was time to go. The Master tooted his horn and off we went. We trotted down the road past Calloose Caravan Park and turned off left down a bumpy lane which led us to a field. The Master sqeezed his horse into a canter and off we went. The wind whistled through our ears as our horses and ponies galloped faster. We went through some rather boggy areas and then we drew to a walk along the edge of a field because it was planted with corn. Then a fox ran over a hedge and so with a toot of the Master's horn and a "Tally Ho" we were off. As we cantered over fields I wondered if we were going to catch the fox?{He {disappeared down a fox hole.}We were all disappointed.
